data.commandItems: The items inside the command, each object will contain a category of items. Each item includes a title, value, icon, and default value. All items will be searchable, but only default items will be visible with an empty search.
data.commandItemsFiltered: A filtered array of all the items. Updated on initialize and as the user types in the search field.
data.commandItemActive: A command item being hovered by the mouse or highlighted by the keyboard.
data.commandItemSelected: A command item that has been selected by the user via mouse click or enter on keyboard.
data.commandId: Each item will have a unique ID, which is used to scroll to element in the event of an overflow of items in the command menu.
data.commandSearch: The search term entered by the user.
data.commandSearchIsEmpty(): A boolean value indicating if the search field is empty or not.
data.commandItemIsActive(item): A boolean value indicating if the command item is active or not.
data.commandItemActiveNext(): Based on the current active item, this will be the next item in the list.
data.commandItemActivePrevious(): Based on the current active item, this will be the previous item in the list.
data.commandScrollToActiveItem(): If there are more commands than can fit in the menu, this will scroll the menu to the active item.
data.commandSearchItems(): This will filter the command items based on the search term.
data.commandShowCategory(item, index): When the user searches, this function will determine if the filtered items contain a category that should be shown.
data.commandCategoryCapitalize(string): Simple helper function to capitalize the category name.
data.commandItemsReorganize(): This will re-organize the commandItems on init. It will flatten them into a single dimensional array. This makes it easier to filter and iterate over the items.

additional.description: Inside the init method is a watcher for the commandItemSelected which console.logs the selected item. Replace the console.log with your own functionality you want to use when a user selects that item.
additional.note: To use this component, all you need do is add your own commandItems and add the desired functionality for when a user selects the item.
